author: Swarley

changelog.release_notes:
1.0:
First Release.


1.1:
*Added the ability to install this watchface on the og Pebble Time, Pebble Time Round and the upcoming Pebble 2 and Pebble Time 2.

#Note that thhere is a chance that this watchface won't not work properly on the Pebble Time Round and Time 2 because of their display's shape and size respectively.

* Changed the color of the background from black to red (only on the watches that support it, obviously).


1.2:
* Fixed a bug which caused the second digit of the minutes to show an empty square instead sometimes.

* Added a menu icon (in the watchfaces app).


1.3:
*Made this watchface my own (not the general idea of DIGITTMM but the code itself.)

* Changed the background's color once again, this time to Cobalt Blue.

*There's now no flick to show data (weather, bluetooth concetivity, etc.) but only the date under the hours. I changed this because a lot of people, including myself, use the flicking gesture to turn on the backlight, and when in the dark and you want to read the time, the data pops up and the backlight could turn of too soon for you to be able to read the time.

1.4:
*Added a vibration after your watch disconnects from your phone.

1.5:
*Also added an icon to show you that you are disconnected from your phone (bluetooth is off/disconnected).

description:
*****NEW VERSION*****
*****SEARCH FOR "Numbers To Letters - DIGITTMM Edition V2*****
******LINK:  goo.gl/axXqcH  *****


An analog watchface goes digital.


Hours are sitting in the center, while the minutes orbit them.

The time is written in letters instead of numbers:
ON is 1, TW is 2, TH is 3, etc.

The date will be shown under the hours.
Also, the watch will now vibrate and show an icon on screen when it will disconnect from your phone.

Be sure to leave a heart if you liked this watchface, will be much appreciated.
Also, please share your thoughts, tell me if you would like to see some changes, or if you are experiencing any kind of bugs.
